title: Downloading Data from Tesouro Direto
text: Suppose need financial data (prices yields) bond type LTN maturity date equal 2016-01-01. bullet bond basic debt contract Brazilian government issues. pay value (coupon) lifetime pay 1000 R$ maturity. order get data, need run following code R: Let’s plot prices check code worked well.  expected, prices bond converge face value, 1000 R$, maturity date (2016-01-01). can also look time-varying annual yield:  functions GetTDData also work multiple arguments asset.codes maturity. Suppose wanted look prices available maturities bonds type LTN. need add value NULL argument maturity: data downloaded, can plot prices different debt contracts:
code: library(GetTDData)  asset.codes <- 'LTN'   # Identifier of assets  maturity <- '010116'  # Maturity date as string (ddmmyy)  my.flag <- download.TD.data(asset.codes = asset.codes)  my.df <- read.TD.files(asset.codes = asset.codes,                        maturity = maturity) library(ggplot2)  p <- ggplot(data = my.df, aes(x = as.Date(ref.date), y = price.bid, color = asset.code)) p <- p + geom_line(size = 1) + scale_x_date() + labs(title = '', x = 'Dates') print(p) p <- ggplot(data = my.df, aes(x = as.Date(ref.date), y = yield.bid, color = asset.code)) p <- p + geom_line(size = 1) + scale_x_date()+ labs(title = '', x = 'Dates' ) print(p) library(GetTDData) library(ggplot2)  asset.codes <- 'LTN'   # Name of asset maturity <- NULL      # = NULL, downloads all maturities  # download data my.flag <- download.TD.data(asset.codes = asset.codes,                              do.clean.up = F)  # reads data my.df <- read.TD.files(asset.codes = asset.codes,                         maturity = maturity) # plot data (prices) p <- ggplot(data = my.df, aes(x = as.Date(ref.date), y = price.bid, color = asset.code)) p <- p + geom_line() + scale_x_date() + labs(title = '', x = 'Dates', y = 'Prices' ) print(p) # plot data (yields) p <- ggplot(data = my.df, aes(x = as.Date(ref.date), y = yield.bid, color = asset.code)) p <- p + geom_line() + scale_x_date() + labs(title = '', x = 'Dates', y = 'Yields' ) print(p)

title: Downloading the Current Yield Curve
text: can plot derised result:
code: library(GetTDData)  df.yield <- get.yield.curve()   str(df.yield) library(ggplot2)  p <- ggplot(df.yield, aes(x=ref.date, y = value) ) +   geom_line(size=1) + geom_point() + facet_grid(~type, scales = 'free') +    labs(title = paste0('The current Brazilian Yield Curve '),        subtitle = paste0('Date: ', df.yield$current.date[1]))       print(p)

title: Get Data for Brazilian Bonds (Tesouro Direto)
text: Information regarding prices yields bonds issued Brazilian government can downloaded manually excel files Tesouro Direto website. However, can painful aggregate data something useful files don’t uniform format divided year asset code. Package GetTDData makes process importing data Tesouro direto much easier. need order download data name assets (LFT, LTN, NTN-C, NTN-B, NTN-B Principal, NTN-F) desired dates maturity (e.g. 2016-01-01).
